   20: %%----------------------------------------------------------------------
   21: %% File: ct_netconfc_SUITE.erl
   22: %%
   23: %% Description:
   24: %%    This file contains the test cases for the ct_netconfc API.
   25: %%
   26: %% Netconf Client Interface.
   27: %%----------------------------------------------------------------------
   28: %%----------------------------------------------------------------------
   29: -module(netconfc1_SUITE).
   30: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   31: -include_lib("common_test/src/ct_netconfc.hrl").
   32: -include("netconfc_test_lib.hrl").
   33: 
   34: -compile(nowarn_export_all).
   35: -compile(export_all).
   36: 
   37: suite() ->
   38:     [{timetrap,?default_timeout},
   39:      {ct_hooks, [{cth_conn_log,
   40: 		  [{ct_netconfc,[{log_type,html}, %will be overwritten by config
   41: 				 {hosts,[my_named_connection,netconf1]}]
   42: 		   }]
   43: 		 }]
   44:      }].
   45: 
   46: all() ->
   47:     [hello,
   48:      hello_from_server_first,
   49:      hello_named,
   50:      hello_configured,
   51:      hello_configured_extraopts,
   52:      hello_required,
   53:      hello_required_exists,
   54:      hello_global_pwd,
   55:      hello_no_session_id,
   56:      hello_incomp_base_vsn,
   57:      hello_no_base_cap,
   58:      hello_no_caps,
   59:      no_server_hello,
   60:      no_client_hello,
   61:      get_session_id,
   62:      get_capabilities,
   63:      faulty_user,
   64:      faulty_passwd,
   65:      faulty_port,
   66:      no_host,
   67:      no_port,
   68:      invalid_opt,
   69:      timeout_close_session,
   70:      get,
   71:      get_a_lot,
   72:      timeout_get,
   73:      flush_timeout_get,
   74:      get_xpath,
   75:      get_config,
   76:      get_config_xpath,
   77:      edit_config,
   78:      edit_config_opt_params,
   79:      copy_config,
   80:      delete_config,
   81:      lock,
   82:      unlock,
   83:      kill_session,
   84:      get_no_such_client,
   85:      action,
   86:      send_any_rpc,
   87:      send_any,
   88:      hide_password,
   89:      not_proper_xml,
   90:      prefixed_namespace,
   91:      receive_chunked_data,
   92:      timeout_receive_chunked_data,
   93:      close_while_waiting_for_chunked_data,
   94:      connection_crash,
   95:      get_event_streams,
   96:      create_subscription,
   97:      receive_one_event,
   98:      receive_two_events,
   99:      receive_multiple_events,
  100:      receive_event_and_rpc,
  101:      receive_event_and_rpc_in_chunks,
  102:      multiple_channels,
  103:      kill_session_same_connection
  104:     ].
  105: 
  106: groups() ->
  107:     [].
  108: 
  109: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  110:     Config.
  111: 
  112: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  113:     Config.
  114: 
  115: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  116:     ets:delete_all_objects(ns_tab),
  117:     Config.
  118: 
  119: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
  120:     ok.
  121: 
  122: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  123:     code:ensure_loaded(crypto),
  124:     case {ssh:start(),code:is_loaded(crypto)} of
  125: 	{Ok,{file,_}} when Ok==ok; Ok=={error,{already_started,ssh}} ->
  126: 	    ct:log("ssh started",[]),
  127: 	    SshDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  128: 				   "ssh_dir"),
  129: 	    Server = ?NS:start(SshDir),
  130: 	    ct:log("netconf server started",[]),
  131: 	    [{netconf_server,Server},{ssh_dir,SshDir}|Config];
  132: 	Other ->
  133: 	    ct:log("could not start ssh or load crypto: ~p",[Other]),
  134: 	    {skip, "SSH could not be started!"}
  135:     end.
  136: 
  137: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  138:     ?NS:stop(?config(netconf_server,Config)),
  139:     ssh:stop(),
  140:     application:stop(crypto),
  141:     Config.
  142: 
  143: hello(Config) ->
  144:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  145:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  146:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  147:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  148:     ok.
  149: 
  150: hello_from_server_first(Config) ->
  151:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  152:     ?NS:hello(1),
  153:     {ok,Client} = ct_netconfc:only_open(?DEFAULT_SSH_OPTS(SshDir)),
  154:     ct:sleep(500),
  155:     ?NS:expect(hello),
  156:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:hello(Client, [{capability, ["urn:com:ericsson:ebase:1.1.0"]}], infinity),
  157:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  158:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  159:     ok.
  160: 
  161: hello_named(Config) ->
  162:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  163:     {ok,Client} = open_success(any_name,SshDir),
  164:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  165:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  166:     ok.
  167: 
  168: hello_configured() ->
  169:     [{require, netconf1}].
  170: hello_configured(Config) ->
  171:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  172:     {ok,Client} = open_configured_success(netconf1,SshDir),
  173:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  174:     {error, {no_such_name,netconf1}} = ct_netconfc:close_session(netconf1),
  175:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  176:     ok.
  177: 
  178: hello_configured_extraopts() ->
  179:     [{require, netconf1}].
  180: hello_configured_extraopts(Config) ->
  181:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  182:     %% Test that the configuration overwrites the ExtraOpts parameter
  183:     %% to ct_netconfc:open/2.
  184:     {ok,Client} = open_configured_success(netconf1,SshDir,[{password,"faulty"}]),
  185:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  186:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  187:     ok.
  188: 
  189: hello_required() ->
  190:     [{require, my_named_connection, netconf1}].
  191: hello_required(Config) ->
  192:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  193:     {ok,_Client} = open_configured_success(my_named_connection,SshDir),
  194:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  195:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(my_named_connection),
  196:     ok.
  197: 
  198: hello_required_exists() ->
  199:     [{require, my_named_connection, netconf1}].
  200: hello_required_exists(Config) ->
  201:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  202:     {ok,_Client1} = open_configured_success(my_named_connection,SshDir),
  203: 
  204:     %% Check that same name cannot be used twice
  205:     {error,{connection_exists,_Client1}} =
  206: 	ct_netconfc:open(my_named_connection,[{user_dir,SshDir}]),
  207: 
  208:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  209:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(my_named_connection),
  210:     ct:sleep(500),
  211: 
  212:     %% Then check that it can be used again after the first is closed
  213:     {ok,_Client2} = open_configured_success(my_named_connection,SshDir),
  214:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  215:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(my_named_connection),
  216:     ok.
  217: 
  218: hello_global_pwd(Config) ->
  219:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  220:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir,[{user,"any-user"},
  221: 					{password,"global-xxx"}]),
  222:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  223:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  224:     ok.
  225: 
  226: hello_no_session_id(Config) ->
  227:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  228:     ?NS:hello(no_session_id),
  229:     ?NS:expect(no_session_id,hello),
  230:     {error,{incorrect_hello,no_session_id_found}} = open(SshDir),
  231:     ok.
  232: 
  233: hello_incomp_base_vsn(Config) ->
  234:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  235:     ?NS:hello(1,{base,"1.1"}),
  236:     ?NS:expect(hello),
  237:     {error,{incompatible_base_capability_vsn,"1.1"}} = open(SshDir),
  238:     ok.
  239: 
  240: hello_no_base_cap(Config) ->
  241:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  242:     ?NS:hello(1,no_base),
  243:     ?NS:expect(hello),
  244:     {error,{incorrect_hello,no_base_capability_found}} = open(SshDir),
  245:     ok.
  246: 
  247: hello_no_caps(Config) ->
  248:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  249:     ?NS:hello(1,no_caps),
  250:     ?NS:expect(hello),
  251:     {error,{incorrect_hello,capabilities_not_found}} = open(SshDir),
  252:     ok.
  253: 
  254: no_server_hello(Config) ->
  255:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  256:     ?NS:expect(undefined,hello),
  257:     {error,{hello_session_failed,timeout}} = open(SshDir,[{timeout,2000}]),
  258:     ok.
  259: 
  260: no_client_hello(Config) ->
  261:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  262:     ?NS:hello(1),
  263:     {ok,Client} = ct_netconfc:only_open(?DEFAULT_SSH_OPTS(SshDir)),
  264: 
  265:     %% Allow server hello to arrive
  266:     ct:sleep(500),
  267: 
  268:     %% Tell server to receive a get request and then die without
  269:     %% replying since no hello has been received. (is this correct
  270:     %% behaviour??)
  271:     ?NS:expect_do(get,close),
  272:     {error,closed} = ct_netconfc:get(Client,whatever),
  273:     ok.
  274: 
  275: get_session_id(Config) ->
  276:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  277:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  278: 
  279:     1 = ct_netconfc:get_session_id(Client),
  280: 
  281:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  282:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  283:     ok.
  284: 
  285: get_capabilities(Config) ->
  286:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  287:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  288: 
  289:     Caps = ct_netconfc:get_capabilities(Client),
  290:     BaseCap = ?NETCONF_BASE_CAP ++ ?NETCONF_BASE_CAP_VSN,
  291:     [BaseCap,"urn:ietf:params:netconf:capability:writable-running:1.0" |_] = Caps,
  292: 
  293:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  294:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  295:     ok.
  296: 
  297: faulty_user(Config) ->
  298:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  299:     {error,{ssh,could_not_connect_to_server,
  300: 	    "Unable to connect using the available authentication methods"}} =
  301: 	open(SshDir,[{user,"yyy"}]),
  302:     ok.
  303: 
  304: faulty_passwd(Config) ->
  305:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  306:     {error,{ssh,could_not_connect_to_server,
  307: 	    "Unable to connect using the available authentication methods"}} =
  308: 	open(SshDir,[{password,"yyy"}]),
  309:     ok.
  310: 
  311: faulty_port(Config) ->
  312:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  313:     {error,{ssh,could_not_connect_to_server,econnrefused}} =
  314: 	open(SshDir,[{port,2062}]),
  315:     ok.
  316: 
  317: no_host(Config) ->
  318:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  319:     Opts = lists:keydelete(ssh,1,?DEFAULT_SSH_OPTS(SshDir)),
  320:     {error,no_host_address} = ct_netconfc:open(Opts),
  321:     ok.
  322: 
  323: no_port(Config) ->
  324:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  325:     Opts = lists:keydelete(port,1,?DEFAULT_SSH_OPTS(SshDir)),
  326:     {error,no_port} = ct_netconfc:open(Opts),
  327:     ok.
  328: 
  329: invalid_opt(Config) ->
  330:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  331:     Opts1 = ?DEFAULT_SSH_OPTS(SshDir) ++ [{timeout,invalidvalue}],
  332:     {error,{invalid_option,{timeout,invalidvalue}}} = ct_netconfc:open(Opts1),
  333:     Opts2 = ?DEFAULT_SSH_OPTS(SshDir) ++ [{some_other_opt,true}],
  334:     {error,{ssh,could_not_connect_to_server,{options,_}}} =
  335: 	ct_netconfc:open(Opts2),
  336:     ok.
  337: 
  338: timeout_close_session(Config) ->
  339:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  340:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  341:     ?NS:expect('close-session'),
  342:     true = erlang:is_process_alive(Client),
  343:     {error,timeout} = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client,1000),
  344:     false = erlang:is_process_alive(Client),
  345:     ok.
  346: 
  347: get(Config) ->
  348:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  349:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  350:     Data = [{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[{name,[],["myserver"]}]}],
  351:     ?NS:expect_reply('get',{data,Data}),
  352:     {ok,Data} = ct_netconfc:get(Client,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
  353:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  354:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  355:     ok.
  356: 
  357: get_a_lot(Config) ->
  358:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  359:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  360:     Descr = lists:append(lists:duplicate(100,"Description of myserver! ")),
  361:     Server = {server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[{name,[],["myserver"]},
  362: 				       {description,[],[Descr]}]},
  363:     Data = lists:duplicate(100,Server),
  364:     ?NS:expect_reply('get',{fragmented,{data,Data}}),
  365:     {ok,Data} = ct_netconfc:get(Client,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
  366:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  367:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  368:     ok.
  369: 
  370: timeout_get(Config) ->
  371:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  372:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  373:     ?NS:expect('get'),
  374:     {error,timeout} = ct_netconfc:get(Client,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]},1000),
  375:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  376:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  377:     ok.
  378: 
  379: %% Test OTP-13008 "ct_netconfc crash when receiving unknown timeout"
  380: %% If the timer expires "at the same time" as the rpc reply is
  381: %% received, the timeout message might already be sent when the timer
  382: %% is cancelled. This test checks that the timeout message is flushed
  383: %% from the message queue. If it isn't, the client crashes and the
  384: %% session cannot be closed afterwards.
  385: %% Note that we can only hope that the test case triggers the problem
  386: %% every now and then, as it is very timing dependent...
  387: flush_timeout_get(Config) ->
  388:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  389:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  390:     Data = [{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[{name,[],["myserver"]}]}],
  391:     ?NS:expect_reply('get',{data,Data}),
  392:     timer:sleep(1000),
  393:     case ct_netconfc:get(Client,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]},1) of
  394: 	{error,timeout} -> ok; % problem not triggered
  395: 	{ok,Data} -> ok % problem possibly triggered
  396:     end,
  397:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  398:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  399:     ok.
  400: 
  401: get_xpath(Config) ->
  402:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  403:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  404:     Data = [{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[{name,[],["myserver"]}]}],
  405:     ?NS:expect_reply({'get',xpath},{data,Data}),
  406:     {ok,Data} = ct_netconfc:get(Client,{xpath,"/server"}),
  407:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  408:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  409:     ok.
  410: 
  411: get_config(Config) ->
  412:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  413:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  414:     Data = [{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[{name,[],["myserver"]}]}],
  415:     ?NS:expect_reply('get-config',{data,Data}),
  416:     {ok,Data} = ct_netconfc:get_config(Client,running,
  417: 				       {server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
  418:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  419:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  420:     ok.
  421: 
  422: get_config_xpath(Config) ->
  423:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  424:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  425:     Data = [{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[{name,[],["myserver"]}]}],
  426:     ?NS:expect_reply({'get-config',xpath},{data,Data}),
  427:     {ok,Data} = ct_netconfc:get_config(Client,running,{xpath,"/server"}),
  428:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  429:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  430:     ok.
  431: 
  432: edit_config(Config) ->
  433:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  434:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  435:     ?NS:expect_reply('edit-config',ok),
  436:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:edit_config(Client,running,
  437: 				  {server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],
  438: 				   [{name,["myserver"]}]}),
  439:     ?NS:expect_reply('edit-config',ok),
  440:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:edit_config(Client,running,
  441: 				  [{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],
  442:                                     [{name,["server1"]}]},
  443:                                    {server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],
  444:                                     [{name,["server2"]}]}]),
  445:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  446:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  447:     ok.
  448: 
  449: edit_config_opt_params(Config) ->
  450:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  451:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  452:     ?NS:expect_reply({'edit-config',{'default-operation',"none"}},ok),
  453:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:edit_config(Client,running,
  454: 				  {server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],
  455: 				   [{name,["myserver"]}]},
  456: 				  [{'default-operation',["none"]}]),
  457:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  458:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  459:     ok.
  460: 
  461: copy_config(Config) ->
  462:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  463:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  464:     ?NS:expect_reply('copy-config',ok),
  465:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:copy_config(Client,startup,running),
  466:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  467:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  468:     ok.
  469: 
  470: delete_config(Config) ->
  471:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  472:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  473:     ?NS:expect_reply('delete-config',ok),
  474:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:delete_config(Client,startup),
  475:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  476:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  477:     ok.
  478: 
  479: lock(Config) ->
  480:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  481:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  482:     ?NS:expect_reply('lock',ok),
  483:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:lock(Client,running),
  484:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  485:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  486:     ok.
  487: 
  488: unlock(Config) ->
  489:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  490:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  491:     ?NS:expect_reply('unlock',ok),
  492:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:unlock(Client,running),
  493:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  494:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  495:     ok.
  496: 
  497: kill_session(Config) ->
  498:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  499:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  500: 
  501:     ?NS:hello(2),
  502:     ?NS:expect(2,hello),
  503:     {ok,OtherClient} = open(SshDir),
  504: 
  505:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('kill-session',{kill,2},ok),
  506:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:kill_session(Client,2),
  507:     {error,_}=ct_netconfc:get(OtherClient,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
  508: 
  509:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  510:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  511: 
  512:     ok.
  513: 
  514: get_no_such_client(Config) ->
  515:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  516:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  517: 
  518:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  519:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  520:     case ct_netconfc:get(Client,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}) of
  521: 	{error,no_such_client} ->
  522: 	    ok;
  523: 	{error,closed} ->
  524: 	    %% Means that the Client process was not terminated before the call.
  525: 	    %% Give it one more go.
  526: 	    {error,no_such_client} =
  527: 		ct_netconfc:get(Client,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]})
  528:     end,
  529:     ok.
  530: 
  531: action(Config) ->
  532:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  533:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  534:     Data = [{myactionreturn,[{xmlns,"myns"}],["value"]}],
  535:     %% test either to receive {data,Data} or {ok,Data},
  536:     %% both need to be handled
  537:     ct:log("Client will receive {~w,~p}", [data,Data]),
  538:     ct:log("Expecting ~p", [{ok, Data}]),
  539:     ?NS:expect_reply(action,{data, Data}),
  540:     {ok, Data} = ct_netconfc:action(Client,{myaction,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
  541: 
  542:     ct:log("Client will receive {~w,~p}", [ok,Data]),
  543:     ct:log("Expecting ~p", [ok]),
  544:     ?NS:expect_reply(action,{ok, Data}),
  545:     ok = ct_netconfc:action(Client,{myaction,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
  546: 
  547:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  548:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  549:     ok.
  550: 
  551: send_any_rpc(Config) ->
  552:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  553:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  554:     Data = [{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[{name,[],["myserver"]}]}],
  555:     GetConf = {'get-config',
  556: 	       [{source,["running"]},
  557: 		{filter,[{type,"subtree"}],
  558: 		 [{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}]}]},
  559:     ?NS:expect_reply('get-config',{data,Data}),
  560:     [{data,?NETCONF_NAMESPACE_ATTR,Data}] = ct_netconfc:send_rpc(Client,GetConf),
  561: 
  562:     EditConf = {'edit-config',
  563: 		[{target,["running"]},
  564: 		 {config,[{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],
  565: 			   [{name,["myserver"]}]}]}]},
  566:     ?NS:expect_reply('edit-config',ok),
  567:     [{ok,?NETCONF_NAMESPACE_ATTR,[]}] = ct_netconfc:send_rpc(Client,EditConf),
  568: 
  569:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  570:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  571:     ok.
  572: 
  573: send_any(Config) ->
  574:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  575:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  576: 
  577:     %% Correct get-config rpc
  578:     Data = [{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[{name,[],["myserver"]}]}],
  579:     RpcAttr1 = ?NETCONF_NAMESPACE_ATTR ++ [{'message-id',"1"}],
  580:     RpcGetConf = {rpc,RpcAttr1,
  581: 		  [{'get-config',
  582: 		    [{source,["running"]},
  583: 		     {filter,[{type,"subtree"}],
  584: 		      [{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}]}]}]},
  585:     ?NS:expect_reply('get-config',{data,Data}),
  586:     {'rpc-reply',RpcAttr1,[{data,_,Data}]} = ct_netconfc:send(Client,RpcGetConf),
  587: 
  588:     %% Correct edit-config rpc
  589:     RpcAttr2 = ?NETCONF_NAMESPACE_ATTR ++ [{'message-id',"2"}],
  590:     RpcEditConf = {rpc,RpcAttr2,
  591: 		   [{'edit-config',
  592: 		     [{target,["running"]},
  593: 		      {config,[{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],
  594: 				[{name,["myserver"]}]}]}]}]},
  595:     ?NS:expect_reply('edit-config',ok),
  596:     {'rpc-reply',RpcAttr2,[{ok,_,[]}]} = ct_netconfc:send(Client,RpcEditConf),
  597: 
  598:     %% Send any data
  599:     ?NS:expect_reply(any,{ok,[],[]}),
  600:     {ok,_,[]} = ct_netconfc:send(Client,{any,[],[]}),
  601: 
  602:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  603:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  604:     ok.
  605: 
  606: hide_password(Config) ->
  607:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  608:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  609:     Password = "my_very_secret_password",
  610:     Data = [{passwords,[{xmlns,"myns"}],
  611: 	     [{password,[{xmlns,"pwdns"}],[Password]},
  612: 	      {password,[],[Password]}]}],
  613:     ?NS:expect_reply('get',{data,Data}),
  614:     ct:capture_start(), % in case of html logging
  615:     {ok,Data} = ct_netconfc:get(Client,{passwords,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
  616:     ct:capture_stop(),
  617:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  618:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  619: 
  620:     Log = filename:join(?config(priv_dir,Config),"hide_password-netconf.txt"),
  621: 
  622:     Text =
  623: 	case file:read_file(Log) of
  624: 	    {ok,Bin} ->
  625: 		Bin;
  626: 	    _NoLog ->
  627: 		%% Assume html logging
  628: 		list_to_binary(ct:capture_get())
  629: 	end,
  630: 
  631:     nomatch = binary:match(Text,list_to_binary(Password)),
  632: 
  633:     ok.
  634: 
  635: not_proper_xml(Config) ->
  636:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  637:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  638:     NS = list_to_binary(?NETCONF_NAMESPACE),
  639:     NotProper = <<"<rpc-reply message-id=\"1\" xmlns=\"",
  640: 		  NS/binary,"\"><data></rpc-reply>">>,
  641:     ?NS:expect_reply('get',NotProper),
  642:     {error,{failed_to_parse_received_data,_}} =
  643: 	ct_netconfc:get(Client,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
  644:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  645:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  646:     ok.
  647: 
  648: prefixed_namespace(Config) ->
  649:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  650:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  651:     NS = list_to_binary(?NETCONF_NAMESPACE),
  652: 
  653:     %% Test that data element can be properly decoded and that
  654:     %% prefixed namespace attributes (exepct the netconf namespace)
  655:     %% are forwarded to the content of the data element - i.e. that
  656:     %% the xmlns:my is forwarded from the rpc-reply element to the
  657:     %% server element below.
  658:     Data = <<"<nc:rpc-reply message-id=\"1\" xmlns:nc=\"",
  659: 	     NS/binary,"\" xmlns:my=\"myns\"><nc:data><my:server>",
  660: 	     "<my:name my:lang=\"en\">myserver</my:name></my:server>"
  661: 	     "</nc:data></nc:rpc-reply>">>,
  662:     ?NS:expect_reply('get',Data),
  663:     {ok,[{'my:server',[{'xmlns:my',"myns"}],
  664: 	  [{'my:name',[{'my:lang',"en"}],["myserver"]}]}]} =
  665: 	ct_netconfc:get(Client,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
  666: 
  667:     Ok = <<"<nc:rpc-reply message-id=\"2\" xmlns:nc=\"",
  668: 	   NS/binary,"\"><nc:ok/></nc:rpc-reply>">>,
  669:     ?NS:expect_reply('edit-config',Ok),
  670:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:edit_config(Client,running,
  671: 				  {server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],
  672: 				   [{name,["myserver"]}]}),
  673: 
  674:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  675:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  676:     ok.
  677: 
  678: %% Test that the client can parse data which is received in chunks,
  679: %% i.e. when the complete rpc-reply is not contained in one single ssh
  680: %% data message.
  681: receive_chunked_data(Config) ->
  682:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  683:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  684: 
  685:     %% Construct the data to return from netconf server
  686:     Data = [{servers,[{xmlns,"myns"}],
  687: 	     [{server,[],[{name,[],["server0"]}]},
  688: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server1"]}]},
  689: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server2"]}]},
  690: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server3"]}]},
  691: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server4"]}]},
  692: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server5"]}]},
  693: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server6"]}]},
  694: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server7"]}]},
  695: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server8"]}]},
  696: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server9"]}]}]
  697: 	    }],
  698:     Rpc = {'rpc-reply',?NETCONF_NAMESPACE_ATTR ++ [{'message-id',"1"}],
  699: 	   [{data,Data}]},
  700:     Xml = list_to_binary(xmerl:export_simple_element(Rpc,xmerl_xml)),
  701:     Netconf =
  702: 	<<"<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>\n",
  703: 	  Xml/binary,"\n",?END_TAG/binary>>,
  704: 
  705:     %% Split the data in some chunks
  706:     PartLength = size(Netconf) div 3,
  707:     <<Part1:PartLength/binary,Part2:PartLength/binary,Part3:PartLength/binary,
  708:       Part4/binary>> = Netconf,
  709: 
  710:     %% Spawn a process which will wait a bit for the client to send
  711:     %% the request (below), then order the server to the chunks of the
  712:     %% rpc-reply one by one.
  713:     spawn(fun() -> ct:sleep(500),?NS:hupp(send,Part1),
  714: 		   ct:sleep(100),?NS:hupp(send,Part2),
  715: 		   ct:sleep(100),?NS:hupp(send,Part3),
  716: 		   ct:sleep(100),?NS:hupp(send,Part4)
  717: 	  end),
  718: 
  719:     %% Order server to expect a get - then the process above will make
  720:     %% sure the rpc-reply is sent.
  721:     ?NS:expect('get'),
  722:     {ok,Data} = ct_netconfc:get(Client,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
  723: 
  724:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  725:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  726:     ok.
  727: 
  728: %% Same as receive_chunked_data, but timeout waiting for last part.
  729: timeout_receive_chunked_data(Config) ->
  730:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  731:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  732: 
  733:     %% Construct the data to return from netconf server
  734:     Data = [{servers,[{xmlns,"myns"}],
  735: 	     [{server,[],[{name,[],["server0"]}]},
  736: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server1"]}]},
  737: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server2"]}]},
  738: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server3"]}]},
  739: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server4"]}]},
  740: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server5"]}]},
  741: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server6"]}]},
  742: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server7"]}]},
  743: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server8"]}]},
  744: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server9"]}]}]
  745: 	    }],
  746:     Rpc = {'rpc-reply',?NETCONF_NAMESPACE_ATTR ++ [{'message-id',"1"}],
  747: 	   [{data,Data}]},
  748:     Xml = list_to_binary(xmerl:export_simple_element(Rpc,xmerl_xml)),
  749:     Netconf =
  750: 	<<"<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>\n",
  751: 	  Xml/binary,"\n",?END_TAG/binary>>,
  752: 
  753:     %% Split the data in some chunks
  754:     PartLength = size(Netconf) div 3,
  755:     <<Part1:PartLength/binary,Part2:PartLength/binary,_Part3:PartLength/binary,
  756:       _Part4/binary>> = Netconf,
  757: 
  758:     %% Spawn a process which will wait a bit for the client to send
  759:     %% the request (below), then order the server to the chunks of the
  760:     %% rpc-reply one by one.
  761:     spawn(fun() -> ct:sleep(500),?NS:hupp(send,Part1),
  762: 		   ct:sleep(100),?NS:hupp(send,Part2)
  763: 	  end),
  764: 
  765:     %% Order server to expect a get - then the process above will make
  766:     %% sure the rpc-reply is sent - but only a part of it - then timeout.
  767:     ?NS:expect('get'),
  768:     {error,timeout} = ct_netconfc:get(Client,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]},2000),
  769: 
  770:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  771:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  772:     ok.
  773: 
  774: %% Same as receive_chunked_data, but close while waiting for last part.
  775: close_while_waiting_for_chunked_data(Config) ->
  776:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  777:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  778: 
  779:     %% Construct the data to return from netconf server
  780:     Data = [{servers,[{xmlns,"myns"}],
  781: 	     [{server,[],[{name,[],["server0"]}]},
  782: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server1"]}]},
  783: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server2"]}]},
  784: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server3"]}]},
  785: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server4"]}]},
  786: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server5"]}]},
  787: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server6"]}]},
  788: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server7"]}]},
  789: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server8"]}]},
  790: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server9"]}]}]
  791: 	    }],
  792:     Rpc = {'rpc-reply',?NETCONF_NAMESPACE_ATTR ++ [{'message-id',"1"}],
  793: 	   [{data,Data}]},
  794:     Xml = list_to_binary(xmerl:export_simple_element(Rpc,xmerl_xml)),
  795:     Netconf =
  796: 	<<"<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>\n",
  797: 	  Xml/binary,"\n",?END_TAG/binary>>,
  798: 
  799:     %% Split the data in some chunks
  800:     PartLength = size(Netconf) div 3,
  801:     <<Part1:PartLength/binary,Part2:PartLength/binary,_Part3:PartLength/binary,
  802:       _Part4/binary>> = Netconf,
  803: 
  804:     %% Spawn a process which will wait a bit for the client to send
  805:     %% the request (below), then order the server to the chunks of the
  806:     %% rpc-reply one by one.
  807:     spawn(fun() -> ct:sleep(500),?NS:hupp(send,Part1),
  808: 		   ct:sleep(100),?NS:hupp(send,Part2),
  809: 		   ct:sleep(100),?NS:hupp(kill)
  810: 	  end),
  811: 
  812:     %% Order server to expect a get - then the process above will make
  813:     %% sure the rpc-reply is sent - but only a part of it - then close.
  814:     ?NS:expect('get'),
  815:     {error,closed} = ct_netconfc:get(Client,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]},4000),
  816:     ok.
  817: 
  818: connection_crash(Config) ->
  819:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  820:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  821: 
  822:     %% Test that if the test survives killing the connection
  823:     %% process. Earlier this caused ct_util_server to terminate, and
  824:     %% this aborting the complete test run.
  825:     spawn(fun() -> ct:sleep(500),exit(Client,kill) end),
  826:     ?NS:expect(get),
  827:     {error,{closed,killed}}=ct_netconfc:get(Client,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
  828:     ok.
  829: 
  830: get_event_streams(Config) ->
  831:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  832:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
  833:     StreamNames = ["NETCONF","stream1","stream2"],
  834:     Streams = [{N,[{description,"descr of " ++ N}]} || N <- StreamNames],
  835:     StreamsXml = [{stream,[{name,[N]}|[{Tag,[Value]} || {Tag,Value} <- Data]]}
  836:                   || {N,Data} <- Streams],
  837:     ReplyData = [{netconf,?NETMOD_NOTIF_NAMESPACE_ATTR,[{streams,StreamsXml}]}],
  838:     ?NS:expect_reply('get',{data,ReplyData}),
  839:     {ok,Streams} = ct_netconfc:get_event_streams(Client,StreamNames),
  840: 
  841:     ?NS:expect_reply('get',{data,ReplyData}),
  842:     {ok,Streams} = ct_netconfc:get_event_streams(Client,StreamNames,5000),
  843: 
  844:     ?NS:expect('get'),
  845:     {error,timeout} = ct_netconfc:get_event_streams(Client,100),
  846: 
  847:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  848:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  849:     ok.
  850: 
  851: create_subscription(Config) ->
  852:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  853: 
  854:     %% All defaults
  855:     {ok,Client1} = open_success(SshDir),
  856:     ?NS:expect_reply({'create-subscription',[stream]},ok),
  857:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:create_subscription(Client1),
  858:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  859:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client1),
  860: 
  861:     %% All defaults with timeout
  862:     {ok,Client1a} = open_success(SshDir),
  863:     ?NS:expect_reply({'create-subscription',[stream]},ok),
  864:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:create_subscription(Client1a,5000),
  865:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  866:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client1a),
  867: 
  868:     %% All defaults timing out
  869:     {ok,Client1b} = open_success(SshDir),
  870:     ?NS:expect({'create-subscription',[stream]}),
  871:     {error,timeout} = ct_netconfc:create_subscription(Client1b,100),
  872:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  873:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client1b),
  874: 
  875:     %% Stream
  876:     {ok,Client2} = open_success(SshDir),
  877:     ?NS:expect_reply({'create-subscription',[stream]},ok),
  878:     Stream = "some_stream",
  879:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:create_subscription(Client2,Stream),
  880:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  881:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client2),
  882: 
  883:     %% Filter
  884:     {ok,Client3} = open_success(SshDir),
  885:     ?NS:expect_reply({'create-subscription',[stream,filter]},ok),
  886:     Filter = {notification,?NETMOD_NOTIF_NAMESPACE_ATTR,
  887: 	      [eventTime]},
  888:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:create_subscription(Client3,Filter),
  889:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  890:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client3),
  891: 
  892:     %% Filter with timeout
  893:     {ok,Client3a} = open_success(SshDir),
  894:     ?NS:expect_reply({'create-subscription',[stream,filter]},ok),
  895:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:create_subscription(Client3a,Filter,5000),
  896:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  897:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client3a),
  898: 
  899:     %% Filter timing out
  900:     {ok,Client3b} = open_success(SshDir),
  901:     ?NS:expect({'create-subscription',[stream,filter]}),
  902:     {error,timeout}=ct_netconfc:create_subscription(Client3b,Filter,100),
  903:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  904:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client3b),
  905: 
  906:     %% Stream and filter
  907:     {ok,Client4} = open_success(SshDir),
  908:     ?NS:expect_reply({'create-subscription',[stream,filter]},ok),
  909:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:create_subscription(Client4,Stream,Filter),
  910:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  911:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client4),
  912: 
  913:     %% Start/stop time
  914:     {ok,Client5} = open_success(SshDir),
  915:     ?NS:expect_reply({'create-subscription',[stream,startTime,stopTime]},ok),
  916:     StartTime = xs_datetime({D,{H,M,S}}= calendar:local_time()),
  917:     StopTime = xs_datetime({D,{H+2,M,S}}),
  918:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:create_subscription(Client5,StartTime,StopTime),
  919:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  920:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client5),
  921: 
  922:     %% Start/stop time with timeout
  923:     {ok,Client5a} = open_success(SshDir),
  924:     ?NS:expect_reply({'create-subscription',[stream,startTime,stopTime]},ok),
  925:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:create_subscription(Client5a,StartTime,StopTime,5000),
  926:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  927:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client5a),
  928: 
  929:     %% Start/stop time timing out
  930:     {ok,Client5b} = open_success(SshDir),
  931:     ?NS:expect({'create-subscription',[stream,startTime,stopTime]}),
  932:     {error,timeout} =
  933: 	ct_netconfc:create_subscription(Client5b,StartTime,StopTime,100),
  934:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  935:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client5b),
  936: 
  937:     %% Stream and start/stop time
  938:     {ok,Client6} = open_success(SshDir),
  939:     ?NS:expect_reply({'create-subscription',[stream,startTime,stopTime]},ok),
  940:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:create_subscription(Client6,Stream,StartTime,StopTime),
  941:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  942:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client6),
  943: 
  944:     %% Filter and start/stop time
  945:     {ok,Client7} = open_success(SshDir),
  946:     ?NS:expect_reply({'create-subscription',[stream,filter,startTime,stopTime]},
  947: 		    ok),
  948:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:create_subscription(Client7,Filter,
  949: 					  StartTime,StopTime),
  950:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  951:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client7),
  952: 
  953:     %% Stream, filter and start/stop time
  954:     {ok,Client8} = open_success(SshDir),
  955:     ?NS:expect_reply({'create-subscription',[stream,filter,startTime,stopTime]},
  956: 		    ok),
  957:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:create_subscription(Client8,Stream,Filter,
  958: 					  StartTime,StopTime),
  959:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  960:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client8),
  961: 
  962:     %% Multiple filters
  963:     {ok,Client9} = open_success(SshDir),
  964:     ?NS:expect_reply({'create-subscription',[stream,filter]},ok),
  965:     MultiFilters = [{event,[{xmlns,"http://my.namespaces.com/event"}],
  966: 		     [{eventClass,["fault"]},
  967: 		      {severity,["critical"]}]},
  968: 		    {event,[{xmlns,"http://my.namespaces.com/event"}],
  969: 		     [{eventClass,["fault"]},
  970: 		      {severity,["major"]}]}],
  971:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:create_subscription(Client9,MultiFilters),
  972:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  973:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client9),
  974: 
  975:     ok.
  976: 
  977: receive_one_event(Config) ->
  978:     receive_events(Config, 1, []).
  979: 
  980: receive_two_events(Config) ->
  981:     receive_events(Config, 2, [{receiver, self()}, {receiver, self()}]).
  982: 
  983: receive_events(Config, N, Opts) ->
  984:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
  985:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir, Opts),
  986:     ?NS:expect_reply({'create-subscription',[stream]},ok),
  987:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:create_subscription(Client),
  988: 
  989:     ?NS:hupp({send_events,1}),
  990: 
  991:     receive_events(N),
  992: 
  993:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
  994:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
  995: 
  996:     ok.
  997: 
  998: receive_events(0) ->
  999:     ok;
 1000: receive_events(N) ->
 1001:     receive
 1002:         {notification,?NETCONF_NOTIF_NAMESPACE_ATTR,
 1003:          [{eventTime,[],[_Time]},
 1004:           {event,[{xmlns,"http://my.namespaces.com/event"}],
 1005:            [{severity,_,_},
 1006:             {description,_,_}]}]} ->
 1007:             ok;
 1008:         Other ->
 1009:             ct:fail({got_unexpected_while_waiting_for_event, Other})
 1010:     after 3000 ->
 1011:             ct:fail(timeout_waiting_for_event)
 1012:     end,
 1013:     receive_events(N-1).
 1014: 
 1015: 
 1016: receive_multiple_events(Config) ->
 1017:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
 1018:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
 1019:     ?NS:expect_reply({'create-subscription',[stream]},ok),
 1020:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:create_subscription(Client),
 1021: 
 1022:     ?NS:hupp({send_events,3}),
 1023: 
 1024:     receive
 1025: 	%% Matching ?NS:make_msg({event,_})
 1026: 	{notification,_,_} ->
 1027: 	    ok;
 1028: 	Other1 ->
 1029: 	    ct:fail({got_unexpected_while_waiting_for_event, Other1})
 1030:     after 3000 ->
 1031: 	    ct:fail(timeout_waiting_for_event)
 1032:     end,
 1033:     receive
 1034: 	%% Matching ?NS:make_msg({event,_})
 1035: 	{notification,_,_} ->
 1036: 	    ok;
 1037: 	Other2 ->
 1038: 	    ct:fail({got_unexpected_while_waiting_for_event, Other2})
 1039:     after 3000 ->
 1040: 	    ct:fail(timeout_waiting_for_event)
 1041:     end,
 1042:     receive
 1043: 	%% Matching ?NS:make_msg({event,_})
 1044: 	{notification,_,_} ->
 1045: 	    ok;
 1046: 	Other3 ->
 1047: 	    ct:fail({got_unexpected_while_waiting_for_event, Other3})
 1048:     after 3000 ->
 1049: 	    ct:fail(timeout_waiting_for_event)
 1050:     end,
 1051: 
 1052:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
 1053:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
 1054: 
 1055:     ok.
 1056: 
 1057: receive_event_and_rpc(Config) ->
 1058:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
 1059:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
 1060: 
 1061:     ?NS:expect_reply({'create-subscription',[stream]},ok),
 1062:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:create_subscription(Client),
 1063: 
 1064:     %% Construct the data to return from netconf server - one
 1065:     %% rpc-reply and one notification - to be sent in the same ssh
 1066:     %% package.
 1067:     Data = [{servers,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[{server,[],[{name,[],["myserver"]}]}]}],
 1068:     Rpc = {'rpc-reply',?NETCONF_NAMESPACE_ATTR ++ [{'message-id',"2"}],
 1069: 	   [{data,Data}]},
 1070:     RpcXml = list_to_binary(xmerl:export_simple_element(Rpc,xmerl_xml)),
 1071: 
 1072:     Notification =
 1073: 	{notification,?NETCONF_NOTIF_NAMESPACE_ATTR,
 1074: 	 [{eventTime,["2012-06-14T14:50:54+02:00"]},
 1075: 	  {event,[{xmlns,"http://my.namespaces.com/event"}],
 1076: 	   [{severity,["major"]},
 1077: 	    {description,["Something terrible happened"]}]}]},
 1078:     NotifXml =
 1079: 	list_to_binary(xmerl:export_simple_element(Notification,xmerl_xml)),
 1080: 
 1081:     ?NS:expect_reply('get',[RpcXml,NotifXml]),
 1082:     {ok,Data} = ct_netconfc:get(Client,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
 1083: 
 1084:     receive
 1085: 	{notification,_,_} ->
 1086: 	    ok;
 1087: 	Other1 ->
 1088: 	    ct:fail({got_unexpected_while_waiting_for_event, Other1})
 1089:     after 3000 ->
 1090: 	    ct:fail(timeout_waiting_for_event)
 1091:     end,
 1092: 
 1093: 
 1094:     %% Then do the same again, but now send notification first then
 1095:     %% the rpc-reply.
 1096:     Rpc2 = {'rpc-reply',?NETCONF_NAMESPACE_ATTR ++ [{'message-id',"3"}],
 1097: 	   [{data,Data}]},
 1098:     RpcXml2 = list_to_binary(xmerl:export_simple_element(Rpc2,xmerl_xml)),
 1099:     ?NS:expect_reply('get',[NotifXml,RpcXml2]),
 1100:     {ok,Data} = ct_netconfc:get(Client,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
 1101: 
 1102:     receive
 1103: 	{notification,_,_} ->
 1104: 	    ok;
 1105: 	Other2 ->
 1106: 	    ct:fail({got_unexpected_while_waiting_for_event, Other2})
 1107:     after 3000 ->
 1108: 	    ct:fail(timeout_waiting_for_event)
 1109:     end,
 1110: 
 1111:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
 1112:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
 1113: 
 1114:     ok.
 1115: 
 1116: 
 1117: receive_event_and_rpc_in_chunks(Config) ->
 1118:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
 1119:     {ok,Client} = open_success(SshDir),
 1120: 
 1121:     ?NS:expect_reply({'create-subscription',[stream]},ok),
 1122:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:create_subscription(Client),
 1123: 
 1124:     %% Construct the data to return from netconf server
 1125:     Data = [{servers,[{xmlns,"myns"}],
 1126: 	     [{server,[],[{name,[],["server0"]}]},
 1127: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server1"]}]},
 1128: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server2"]}]},
 1129: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server3"]}]},
 1130: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server4"]}]},
 1131: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server5"]}]},
 1132: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server6"]}]},
 1133: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server7"]}]},
 1134: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server8"]}]},
 1135: 	      {server,[],[{name,[],["server9"]}]}]
 1136: 	    }],
 1137:     Rpc = {'rpc-reply',?NETCONF_NAMESPACE_ATTR ++ [{'message-id',"2"}],
 1138: 	   [{data,Data}]},
 1139:     RpcXml = list_to_binary(xmerl:export_simple_element(Rpc,xmerl_xml)),
 1140: 
 1141:     Notification =
 1142: 	{notification,?NETCONF_NOTIF_NAMESPACE_ATTR,
 1143: 	 [{eventTime,["2012-06-14T14:50:54+02:00"]},
 1144: 	  {event,[{xmlns,"http://my.namespaces.com/event"}],
 1145: 	   [{severity,["major"]},
 1146: 	    {description,["Something terrible happened"]}]}]},
 1147:     NotifXml =
 1148: 	list_to_binary(xmerl:export_simple_element(Notification,xmerl_xml)),
 1149: 
 1150: 
 1151:     %% First part contains a notif, but only parts of the end tag
 1152:     Part1 =
 1153: 	<<"<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>\n",
 1154: 	  NotifXml/binary,"\n]]">>,
 1155: 
 1156:     %% Second part contains rest of end tag, full rpc-reply and full
 1157:     %% notif except end tag
 1158:     Part2 =
 1159: 	<<">]]>\n",RpcXml/binary,"\n",?END_TAG/binary,NotifXml/binary>>,
 1160: 
 1161:     %% Third part contains last end tag
 1162:     Part3 = <<"\n",?END_TAG/binary,"\n">>,
 1163: 
 1164:     %% Spawn a process which will wait a bit for the client to send
 1165:     %% the request (below), then order the server to the chunks of the
 1166:     %% rpc-reply one by one.
 1167:     spawn(fun() -> ct:sleep(500),?NS:hupp(send,Part1),
 1168: 		   ct:sleep(100),?NS:hupp(send,Part2),
 1169: 		   ct:sleep(100),?NS:hupp(send,Part3)
 1170: 	  end),
 1171: 
 1172:     %% Order server to expect a get - then the process above will make
 1173:     %% sure the rpc-reply is sent.
 1174:     ?NS:expect('get'),
 1175:     {ok,Data} = ct_netconfc:get(Client,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
 1176: 
 1177:     receive
 1178: 	{notification,_,_} ->
 1179: 	    ok;
 1180: 	Other1 ->
 1181: 	    ct:fail({got_unexpected_while_waiting_for_event, Other1})
 1182:     after 3000 ->
 1183: 	    ct:fail(timeout_waiting_for_event)
 1184:     end,
 1185:     receive
 1186: 	{notification,_,_} ->
 1187: 	    ok;
 1188: 	Other2 ->
 1189: 	    ct:fail({got_unexpected_while_waiting_for_event, Other2})
 1190:     after 3000 ->
 1191: 	    ct:fail(timeout_waiting_for_event)
 1192:     end,
 1193:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
 1194:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client),
 1195:     ok.
 1196: 
 1197: multiple_channels(Config) ->
 1198:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
 1199:     SshOpts = ?DEFAULT_SSH_OPTS(SshDir),
 1200:     {ok,Conn} = ct_netconfc:connect(SshOpts),
 1201:     ?NS:hello(1),
 1202:     ?NS:expect(hello),
 1203:     {ok,Client1} = ct_netconfc:session(Conn),
 1204:     ?NS:hello(2),
 1205:     ?NS:expect(2,hello),
 1206:     {ok,Client2} = ct_netconfc:session(Conn),
 1207:     ?NS:hello(3),
 1208:     ?NS:expect(3,hello),
 1209:     {ok,Client3} = ct_netconfc:session(Conn),
 1210: 
 1211:     Data = [{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[{name,[],["myserver"]}]}],
 1212:     ?NS:expect_reply(1,'get',{data,Data}),
 1213:     {ok,Data} = ct_netconfc:get(Client1,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
 1214:     ?NS:expect_reply(2,'get',{data,Data}),
 1215:     {ok,Data} = ct_netconfc:get(Client2,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
 1216:     ?NS:expect_reply(3,'get',{data,Data}),
 1217:     {ok,Data} = ct_netconfc:get(Client3,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
 1218: 
 1219:     ?NS:expect_do_reply(2,'close-session',close,ok),
 1220:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client2),
 1221: 
 1222:     ?NS:expect_reply(1,'get',{data,Data}),
 1223:     {ok,Data} = ct_netconfc:get(Client1,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
 1224:     {error,no_such_client}=ct_netconfc:get(Client2,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
 1225:     ?NS:expect_reply(3,'get',{data,Data}),
 1226:     {ok,Data} = ct_netconfc:get(Client3,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
 1227: 
 1228:     ?NS:expect_do_reply(1,'close-session',close,ok),
 1229:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client1),
 1230:     ?NS:expect_do_reply(3,'close-session',close,ok),
 1231:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client3),
 1232: 
 1233:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:disconnect(Conn),
 1234:     ok.
 1235: 
 1236: kill_session_same_connection(Config) ->
 1237:     SshDir = ?config(ssh_dir,Config),
 1238:     SshOpts = ?DEFAULT_SSH_OPTS(SshDir),
 1239:     {ok,Conn} = ct_netconfc:connect(SshOpts),
 1240:     ?NS:hello(1),
 1241:     ?NS:expect(hello),
 1242:     {ok,Client1} = ct_netconfc:session(Conn),
 1243:     ?NS:hello(2),
 1244:     ?NS:expect(2,hello),
 1245:     {ok,Client2} = ct_netconfc:session(Conn),
 1246: 
 1247:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('kill-session',{kill,2},ok),
 1248:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:kill_session(Client1,2),
 1249:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1250:     {error,no_such_client}=ct_netconfc:get(Client2,{server,[{xmlns,"myns"}],[]}),
 1251: 
 1252:     ?NS:expect_do_reply('close-session',close,ok),
 1253:     ?ok = ct_netconfc:close_session(Client1),
 1254: 
 1255:     ok.
 1256: 
 1257: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 1258: 
 1259: break(_Config) ->
 1260:     ct:break("break test case").
 1261: 
 1262: br() ->
 1263:     ct:break("").
 1264: 
 1265: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 1266: %% Open a netconf session which is not specified in a config file
 1267: open_success(Dir) ->
 1268:     open_success(Dir,[]).
 1269: 
 1270: %% Open a netconf session which is not specified in a config file, and
 1271: %% give some extra options in addition to the test defaults.
 1272: open_success(Dir,ExtraOpts) when is_list(Dir), is_list(ExtraOpts) ->
 1273:     ?NS:hello(1), % tell server to send hello with session id 1
 1274:     ?NS:expect(hello), % tell server to expect a hello message from client
 1275:     open(Dir,ExtraOpts);
 1276: 
 1277: %% Open a named netconf session which is not specified in a config file
 1278: open_success(KeyOrName,Dir) when is_atom(KeyOrName), is_list(Dir) ->
 1279:     ?NS:hello(1),
 1280:     ?NS:expect(hello),
 1281:     ct_netconfc:open(KeyOrName,?DEFAULT_SSH_OPTS(Dir)).
 1282: 
 1283: open(Dir) ->
 1284:     open(Dir,[]).
 1285: open(Dir,ExtraOpts) ->
 1286:     Opts = lists:ukeymerge(1,lists:keysort(1,ExtraOpts),
 1287: 			   lists:keysort(1,?DEFAULT_SSH_OPTS(Dir))),
 1288:     ct_netconfc:open(Opts).
 1289: 
 1290: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 1291: %%% Open a netconf session which is specified in a config file
 1292: %%% KeyOrName is the config key (server_id()) or name given in a
 1293: %%% require statement (target_name()).
 1294: open_configured_success(KeyOrName,Dir) when is_atom(KeyOrName) ->
 1295:     open_configured_success(KeyOrName,Dir,[]).
 1296: open_configured_success(KeyOrName,Dir,ExtraOpts) when is_atom(KeyOrName) ->
 1297:     ?NS:hello(1),
 1298:     ?NS:expect(hello),
 1299:     ct_netconfc:open(KeyOrName,[{user_dir,Dir}|ExtraOpts]).
 1300: 
 1301: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 1302: %%% Convert erlang datetime to the simplest variant of XML dateTime
 1303: xs_datetime({{Y,M,D},{H,Mi,S}}) ->
 1304:     lists:flatten(
 1305:       io_lib:format("~p-~s-~sT~s:~s:~s",[Y,pad(M),pad(D),pad(H),pad(Mi),pad(S)])).
 1306: 
 1307: pad(I) when I<10 ->
 1308:     "0"++integer_to_list(I);
 1309: pad(I) ->
 1310:     integer_to_list(I).
